introduction.paragraph: Now that you have all the tools installed, you can build the Todo Lite app. If you have problems building the app, see the section.
Get out a stopwatch, your 5 minutes starts now!

list-item.paragraph: Open a terminal window and change to the directory that you want to store the Todo Lite project in.
Create a new PhoneGap project and change to its directory:
list-item.code-block: $ phonegap create todo-lite com.couchbase.TodoLite TodoLite $ cd todo-lite
list-item.paragraph: After you create a new PhoneGap project, the project directory contains a directory named www. The www directory contains a default application.
Add the Couchbase Lite plug-in to your project:
Add the following additional plug-ins to your project:
list-item.code-block: $ phonegap local plugin add https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/cordova-plugin-camera.git $ phonegap local plugin add https://github.com/apache/cordova-plugin-inappbrowser.git $ phonegap local plugin add https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/cordova-plugin-network-information.git
list-item.paragraph: These plug-ins activate the camera, the InAppBrowser, and network information.
Replace the default application in the www directory with the Todo Lite source code:
When you develop your own app, replace the default application in the www directory with your source code.
Build and run the Todo Lite iOS app:
The Todo Lite app opens in the iOS simulator. If the iOS simulator does not open automatically, make sure ios-sim is installed.
Build and run the Todo Lite Android app:

The Todo Lite app opens in the Android simulator. If the Android simulator does not open and you are prompted to log on to the Adobe PhoneGap build service, your Android device emulator is not set up correctly. You do not need to sign up for the PhoneGap build service to run this example.
